keyword: calories in split pea soup with ham
title: Calories in Split Pea Soup with Ham
meta_description: Discover calories in split pea soup with ham per cup, including protein, carbs, fat, sodium details, and recipe tweaks for better nutrition.
h1: Calories in Split Pea Soup with Ham
assumptions: Standard homemade recipe: 1 cup (245 g) serving with split peas, diced ham (about 2 oz), carrots, onions, no added cream; cooked in water or low-fat broth.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ham type, portion size, and added ingredients like oil or cream. Check labels for canned versions.

quick_answer.text: One cup of split pea soup with ham provides ~200 kcal, 12 g protein, and is high in fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged soups.

tweaks.label: Vegetarian version (omit ham, add extra peas)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of split pea soup with ham?
faqs.a: About 200 kcal per 1-cup serving under standard recipe assumptions.

faqs.q: Is split pea soup with ham high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, it offers ~12 g protein per cup, mainly from peas and ham.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in split pea soup with ham?
faqs.a: Around 10 g dietary fiber per cup, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in split pea soup with ham?
faqs.a: Ham and broth contribute ~800 mg sodium per cup; opt for low-sodium ingredients to reduce.

faqs.q: How do canned vs. homemade calories compare?
faqs.a: Canned versions may have 180-220 kcal per cup; homemade allows control over added fats and salts.
